summary: Completed comprehensive frontend testing of InfluencerHub app across all 4 portals. All UI components, navigation, styling, and layout are working perfectly. API integration shows expected behavior with placeholder Supabase configuration.

api_placeholder_setup.issue: API calls fail gracefully due to placeholder Supabase configuration
api_placeholder_setup.impact: Influencer discovery section shows no results

integration_issues.issue: Search results empty due to API placeholder setup
integration_issues.fix_priority: EXPECTED - API will work once Supabase is configured

passed_tests: Storefront page loads with premium hero section and navigation
Storefront shows 'Find creators who move markets' headline with red accent
Story sections visible with 3 chapters and proper content
Horizontal scroll deck displays 4 cards with progress dots
Discovery section shows search filters (input, dropdown, button)
CTA section displays 3 cards for Brands, Influencers, and Pricing
Brand Portal loads with sidebar navigation (Discover, Campaign Tray, My Requests, Saved)
Brand Portal shows discover filters and campaign form with all fields
Influencer Portal loads with Profile Builder form
Influencer Portal shows all 4 sections: Basic Information, Platform Links, Audience Metrics, Rates & Packages
Admin Portal loads with login form and proper authentication flow
Admin Portal sidebar shows all tabs: Login, Dashboard, Influencers, Brands, Requests
Navigation bar shows InfluencerHub logo with red dot
Syne font applied to headings, Inter font for body text
Red accent color (#E11D48) used consistently for buttons and highlights
All portal navigation links working correctly
Responsive layout with proper sidebar and panel structure
Tab switching functionality working in all portals
Form elements properly structured with correct data-testid attributes
action_item_for_main_agent: Configure Supabase environment variables (SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY) to enable API functionality. All frontend components are working perfectly and ready for backend integration.
